website_summaries.verdict: The Salomon Fellraiser is a trail running shoe that offers stability while running on muddy surfaces. According to some runners, this shoe does not keep mud and water out. It is not fast drying and lacks the needed grip when it comes to wet and muddy terrains.
pros: The shoe has a breathable mesh upper for a well-ventilated ride
Most runners liked the quick lacing system of the Salomon Fellraiser
The Fellraiser has enough cushioning and support, according to most reviews
It has protective toe cap that protects the foot from debris, especially when running on rough trails
cons: Some runners said that the shoe had a tighter feel and that they experienced blisters
Others complained that the sole unit was not durable
The shoe was not as fast-drying as advertised

customer_reviews.title: Good grip, decent cushioning.
customer_reviews.text: Because I had the chance to try a pair of salomons on a trial run, I knew to buy a size 10, I am usually a 9 to 9 and a half. Buy at least half a size up on your normal size. Good grip, probably slightly better than my old much cheaper pair, although hard to compare as these were worn down, particularly at the heel causing slipping on down hill. The lacing is, however, so much better if it needs tightening for downhill, especially if muddy, no struggling with double knots. Have to see how they wear, but so far seems a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with these runners. The other reviewers have covered all the main important points. A few things for me. Sizing; do order a half size or size larger than you would normally. The laces are QUICK LACE and are tighted with a little toggle. The toggle is then tucked into the shoe tongue(various tutorials available by searching). The biggest improvement I noticed was that by foot felt a lot more comfortable and secure in wet/muddy conditions as opposed to me road shoe.
customer_reviews.author: kev spleen

customer_reviews.title: Great mud shoes
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are difficult to fault. They provide grip in the mud where my old shoes left me sliding but they are a little skittish on the pavement. Not waterproof so you get wet feet in deeper water but they warm up and are comfortable afterwards. I'd say they are a little narrow and small in fit but otherwise great. They will save an expensive pair of road shoes from being ruined in the mud and allow you to continue to run in the worst of conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, reliable, sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my first 'proper shoe', having recently completed Couch to 5k. They are comfortable, have great grip on mud and feel like high quality shoes. I had been previously using in-soles following plantar fasciitis issues, but these have a special 'orthotic' (?) cushion inside, which gives really good arch support. I followed the advice above and bought half a size bigger. Wouldn't have fitted otherwise. Arrived way before it was supposed to - very good service.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Hindman

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for price
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Fit as expected for me. They fit my foot like a glove. My first run I ran 4 miles straight off from new with no adversity. I have used them on mud and trails so far. On harder surfaces like roads I wouldn't expect them to be as comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Alfie_G

customer_reviews.title: These seem wonderful - been for a few runs in them now ...
customer_reviews.text: These seem wonderful - been for a few runs in them now and they are working well, good grip in wet / muddy conditions and light to wear. I just wish they were waterproof which would make sense for shoes designed for running in wet/muddy conditions?
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lee

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: A bit push my toe on one leg. I think need producing a half size bigger shoes as well in the future.
customer_reviews.author: bertalan csizmas

customer_reviews.title: A good sturdy shoe for trail walking
customer_reviews.text: Excellent customer service. I bought size 10.5 UK for my husband and returned for size 11 UK. They come up a little smaller, my husband is generally a size 10.5 in all shoes. The new shoes were sent out within 24hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to do the coast to coast. The survived that but only just I have gotten about 300 miles from them and are now falling to bits and starting to rub the back of my heel. I would pay a little more for better quality next time
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Neil

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Only done a couple of runs in these so far but they feel great. They are lightweight, comfy and have great grip.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony McNally

customer_reviews.title: so these are awesome, a little tight when you first put them ...
customer_reviews.text: so these are awesome, a little tight when you first put them on but within a couple of days of wearing them they fit like a glove. spend quite a bit of time on my feet with work and decided to wear them for a day to see what would happen, now wearing them constantly as they are so comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent trainers and one of the quickest deliveries I have ever had. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MARK F.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Needed to go a 1/2 size up to get the correct fit. Looks very well made and feels very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dudt

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like them. Good price. Comfy from the off. Quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Mr C.

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I ever had
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected. Fast delivery and got VAT refund on time as I leave at BFPO address. This is my second time buy on this shoes and loved it. Always go for half size up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great off road running boot
customer_reviews.text: These are my first 'off road' running shoes. Nice and comfy, loads of grip when running around the mid and through the forest I live near. The quick lace system is awesome and good when your hands are a bit cold, pull to tighten and tuck the excess away and your done. Would really recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: tommy tappers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, excellent support and great grip up & down mountain in bog and on rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Scott White

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Very light. Good water resistance. Bit narrow across the toes but I have wide feet. Can't complain they've been great on the mucky uphills at my local.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Melnychuk

customer_reviews.title: Top quality!
customer_reviews.text: Used these for a few runs now and they are very comfortable. Perfect size and nice design!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: They look great but I didn't like the quick lace system so ...
customer_reviews.text: They look great but I didn't like the quick lace system so ordered some normal laces from Foot Rope via Amazon (thin, mustard yellow) which perfectly match the black and yellow shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Karl H.

customer_reviews.title: Salomon Trail trainers
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I notice with the salomon trail shoes is how comfy they are. The 2nd thing is the grip, so good on tough terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Chlopas

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A very good shoe but salomon's shoe size is a bit smaller than others.
customer_reviews.author: andval

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoe.  Great seller
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe. Just as research suggested I bought a half size larger. Very comfortable and good grippy sole. Lacing system works really well. Instep support for over pronation. Sellers service was great. Communication and delivery could not be faulted. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: penfoldio

customer_reviews.title: light and will be great for soft and muddy hills
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is tight on these. Sportshoes.com replaced for a half size up with zero hassle. Otherwise, they're​sturdy, light and will be great for soft and muddy hills. A bit too aggressive for dry trails but they'll cope with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant shoes. Comfortable, light and grip well on mountain hikes I've done since the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Shoes were too small in length when I purchased my regular shoe size. Re- ordered for half size up which appear to be a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Deluce

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Have had these before so already know that it's a good shoe. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: First impression good
customer_reviews.text: Good support, comfortable, good insole good grip. The test will be how long the sole sticks to the upper
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: shoes excellent, good advice to get a half size bigger ...
customer_reviews.text: Very timely delivery, shoes excellent, good advice to get a half size bigger than you would normally take in other makes such as Brookes
customer_reviews.author: Richard Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality hill runner
customer_reviews.text: Hi had these for two months now and done many an urban and hill runs in very wet conditions and the shoe is holding up very well. They are well made but are slightly on the small side, I say the size 10 is more like a snug 9.5.
customer_reviews.author: R Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cross country running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cross country running shoe. The grip is the best I have encountered and the lace mechanism is well thought out preventing the build up of mud.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan Manning

customer_reviews.title: ... trouble (return postage was expensive) and I'm now very happy with them after wearing a couple of times
customer_reviews.text: Changed for a size 12 without too much trouble (return postage was expensive) and I'm now very happy with them after wearing a couple of times. Whatever you do order a size larger than you need,
customer_reviews.author: Mr M A Guy

customer_reviews.title: very pleased with this trainer
customer_reviews.text: Quick delivery, very pleased with this trainer. When I look to buy some more, would def buy another pair of Salomon's
customer_reviews.author: Dan Cotton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, brilliant for trail running in Ireland when its often wet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoe for mountain running, great tread and great durability.
customer_reviews.author: Erin K Bashaw

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected and plenty of grip in the winter ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected and plenty of grip in the winter on the Yorkshire moors. 4 stars as I would prefer conventional laces
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: who was very happy with
customer_reviews.text: Bought for someone else, who was very happy with them
customer_reviews.author: Carole Melville

customer_reviews.title: are very light weight and have good grip in muddy conditions
customer_reviews.text: Trainers fit well, are very light weight and have good grip in muddy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: jack o'neill

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as good as Speedcross 3, but cheaper...
customer_reviews.text: Aggressive tread pattern is welcome on soft ground, but the sole material seems to be a harder compound than the Speedcross 3's - so be careful on wet rock (they slip)... I expect they'll last longer than the Speedcrosses. The price is good. To be honest, I'll probably go back to Speedcross 3's again - I just wish the uppers didn't split and they were a bit cheaper....
customer_reviews.author: Stax

customer_reviews.title: Personally I would use fellcross 3 or sense 3 soft ground for hill running as they are miles lighter with a lot better grip but
customer_reviews.text: Robust but very very heavy for a fell running shoe. Personally I would use fellcross 3 or sense 3 soft ground for hill running as they are miles lighter with a lot better grip but these are alot cheaper I suppose
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Good, bit narrow
customer_reviews.text: Quite narrow, I have relatively wide feet and ordered a size up (10 instead of 9) and they are find and not really too long. Not a fan of the drawstring thing, just flaps around and gets in the way! Cut them off and put some laces in. Chunky tread. Winner for 42 quid.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Reeve

customer_reviews.title: salomons are the best about, but I would advise that you order ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't fault them ,salomons are the best about,but I would advise that you order a half size bigger
customer_reviews.author: Mark Cuthbertson

customer_reviews.title: I've ran about 100+km in these shoes so far, ...
customer_reviews.text: I've ran about 100+km in these shoes so far, mostly muddy trails and similar through forest and mountainous terrain. Since I often encountered steep climbs or the reverse, I can vouch for the effectiveness of these shoes' grip as well as hold of the foot.
customer_reviews.author: Mathieu Lohr

customer_reviews.title: Spring Along in comfort
customer_reviews.text: Took advice from previous reviewers and bought half a size bigger than normal. Thanks to all who recommended the action. These are great shoes on muddy inclines and rough terrain, yet surprisingly comfy and springy on the inevitable tarmac sections. I use them for trail rather than fell and they are superb. I've changed to Salomon from another high-profile, well respected brand and despite those being very good shoes, I will never go back. Fellraisers are excellent value and first choice for a fairly heavy (12stone 9lb), pronating old jogger such as me.
customer_reviews.author: D. A

product_meta.title: SALOMON Men's Fellraiser Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Lace pocket: provides easy storage for the quick fit lacing system. Sensifit: sensifit system works to cradle the foot providing a precise and secure fit. Quick lace: minimalistic and strong lace for one-pull tightening. Easy-on, easy-off. Non marking contagrip: delivering optimal traction on varied surfaces, salomon's contagrip outsoles use the ideal combination of specialized rubbers for each specific use. Molded eva: provides excellent next to foot cushioning and anatomical support: eva shaped footbed: provides excellent cushioning and anatomically designed support. Ortholite: ortholite sockliner combines a specific ortholite foam and an eva heel cup. Ortholite foam creates a cooler, drier, healthier, better cushioned environment under the foot. It will not break down or lose effectiveness over time. Recycled tire content to protect the environment. Eva heel cups allows for a better heel support and added cushioning. Protective synthetic toe cap. Breathable open mesh. Low profile. Injected eva. Fell running last. Tongue cover: tongue protection from mud and debris getting inside the shoe.
feature_bullets: Low lightweight trail shoe that delivers optimal traction on varied surfaces
